summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York to attorneys for the Epstein estate, following up on a request for photographs and videos from Epstein's Florida and New Mexico properties. The email confirms prior discussions about the estate's lack of surveillance videos and physical video recordings, and inquires about the possibility of obtaining digital photos of physical photographs found at the properties.

events.title: Prior discussion about evidence from Epstein properties
events.description: The AUSA and estate attorneys discussed a request for photographs and videos from Epstein's Florida and New Mexico residences. The estate indicated no possession of historical surveillance videos or other physical video recordings.

events.title: Epstein's suicide
events.description: Mentioned as a reference point for the non-existence of surveillance videos, which were regularly overwritten and would not exist from before this date.

locations: New Mexico residence (property of Epstein estate)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction of the AUSA)
keyFacts: The Epstein estate and its trustees stated they were not aware of possessing any historical surveillance-type videos from Epstein's properties, noting such video was regularly overwritten and would not exist from before Epstein's suicide.
The estate also stated it was not aware of possessing other physical video recordings.
Physical photographs existed at Epstein's Florida and New Mexico residences that had not been subject to physical search warrants.
The U.S. Attorney's office had previously discussed obtaining digital photos of these physical photographs but was told the estate could not retain or engage anyone to do so in late February 2020.
As of May 2020, the AUSA was following up to see if pandemic circumstances allowed for someone to access the properties to photograph the physical photos.
